definition: to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
to rescue a child/Save the Children, a British charity

sentences.english: It is better to weed out the bad businesses within the group rather than cross-subsidise them to save face.
sentences.chinese: 將集團內的不良業務剔除，好過爲了面子予以挽救。

sentences.english: Skywalker sought to turn him from the dark side.
sentences.chinese: 天行者期望能將他從黑暗面挽救出來。

sentences.english: There was no denying that she had compromised herself irretrievably .
sentences.chinese: 她已經無可挽救地跟他妥協，那是不能否認的了。

sentences.english: Only the patient has a slice of hope, doctor has the responsibility to save him.
sentences.chinese: 只要病人還有一息生機，醫生就有挽救。

sentences.english: The typewriter rescued him, at least for a time.
sentences.chinese: 打字機挽救了他，起碼一度挽救過他。

sentences.english: The typewriter rescued him, at least for a time.
sentences.chinese: 打字機挽救了他，起碼一度挽救過他。

sentences.english: This crisis can be overcome only if resistance is carried out jointly by the people and the government.
sentences.chinese: 惟有實行民衆和政府一致的抗戰，才能挽救這個危局。

sentences.english: it was true that the rescued cruel man let fuel oil issue from the tissue.
sentences.chinese: 得到挽救的無情鬚眉真的聽憑燃油從薄紗中流出。

sentences.english: He jeopardized his life to save the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他冒着生命危險挽救那個快要淹死的孩子。

sentences.english: Keeping up-to-date on cancer screening tests saves lives.
sentences.chinese: 及時跟進新的癌症篩查檢測可以挽救健康和生命。

sentences.english: And I will help invalids save their lives.
sentences.chinese: 我將幫忙殘疾人挽救他們的生命。

sentences.english: The lifeguard used mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to save the child's life.
sentences.chinese: 救護員使用了口對口人工呼吸法來挽救那孩子的生命。

sentences.english: Without question, if Tirol could be saved by hellos actions.
sentences.chinese: 一沒有疑難問，要是如容許以挽救泰洛的話。

sentences.english: He was put in to rescue the company by the stockbrokers.
sentences.chinese: 他受股票經紀人之託來挽救這家公司。

sentences.english: Some people have been so desperate to save their homes, they are taking matters into their own hands.
sentences.chinese: 很多人急於想挽救自己的房屋，他們決定自行其事。

sentences.english: Doctors are due to save a patient's life as long as he has a slim chance of survival.
sentences.chinese: 只要病人還有一息生機，醫生就有責任挽救。

definition: to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
